Package org.cesecore.certificates.ca

Class CAConstants

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAConstants
  • public final class CAConstants
extends Object
    Constants for CAs.
    Version:
    $Id: CAConstants.java 27567 2017-12-18 10:12:34Z bastianf $

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int ALLCAS
      Used in profiles and service workers to make the catch all every CA instead of listing individual CAs when operating on them This is duplicated in SecConst
      static int CA_ACTIVE
      The state of a node-local CA with a keypair which is neither expired nor revoked.
      static int CA_EXPIRED
      The state of a node-local or external CA whose certificate has expired.
      static int CA_EXTERNAL
      An external CA without a private key.
      static int CA_OFFLINE
      The state of a node-local CA which has been purposely put offline by the user, i.e a CA whose "CA Service State" is "Offline".
      static int CA_REVOKED
      The state of a node-local CA with a certificate which has been revoked.
      static int CA_UNINITIALIZED
      The initial state of a CA imported using Statedump.
      static int CA_WAITING_CERTIFICATE_RESPONSE
      The state of an external CA where a CSR has been created but the signed certificate has not yet been imported into EJBCA.
      static int CAID_USEUSERDEFINED
      Constants used in the SignSessionBean indicating the userdata defined CA should be used.

    • Field Detail

      • CA_ACTIVE

        public static final int CA_ACTIVE
        The state of a node-local CA with a keypair which is neither expired nor revoked. An active CA should be able to create signatures unless the crypto token associated with the CA is offline, in which case healthcheck will fail. A CA stays in this state until the certificate expires or is revoked.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CA_WAITING_CERTIFICATE_RESPONSE

        public static final int CA_WAITING_CERTIFICATE_RESPONSE
        The state of an external CA where a CSR has been created but the signed certificate has not yet been imported into EJBCA.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CA_EXPIRED

        public static final int CA_EXPIRED
        The state of a node-local or external CA whose certificate has expired. Once a CA's certificate has expired, it will stay in this state indefinitely.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CA_REVOKED

        public static final int CA_REVOKED
        The state of a node-local CA with a certificate which has been revoked.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CA_OFFLINE

        public static final int CA_OFFLINE
        The state of a node-local CA which has been purposely put offline by the user, i.e a CA whose "CA Service State" is "Offline". Healthcheck will be disabled for CAs in this state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CA_EXTERNAL

        public static final int CA_EXTERNAL
        An external CA without a private key. A CA stays in this state until the certificate expires.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CA_UNINITIALIZED

        public static final int CA_UNINITIALIZED
        The initial state of a CA imported using Statedump. In this state, the CA does not have a keypair. The CA can advance to the CA_WAITING_CERTIFICATE_RESPONSE state if a CSR is created for the CA, or it can advance to the CA_ACTIVE state directly, if a keypair is associated with it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CAID_USEUSERDEFINED

        public static final int CAID_USEUSERDEFINED
        Constants used in the SignSessionBean indicating the userdata defined CA should be used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALLCAS

        public static final int ALLCAS
        Used in profiles and service workers to make the catch all every CA instead of listing individual CAs when operating on them This is duplicated in SecConst
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
